src_text: A vuqa na leqa vaka tamata kei na potiki me vaka na vakayagataki ni tuvatuva ni metric, a dua na veisau e yaco mai na kena vakatabakidua na veiliutaki ki na dua na tamata (absolutism) ki na dua na ivakarau ni veiliutaki e taqomaka na tugalala, na tutaki kaukauwa ni lawa era muria na vakailesilesi ena matanitu (republicanism), na vakabauta me tokoni ga na veika baleta na vanua ka sega ni veivakauqeti ni vanua tani (nationalism) kei na vakanananu ni taukena e dua na vanua o ira era lewena ka sega ni dua ga na tamata koya e veiliutaki tiko.
ref_text: There are a lot of social and political effects such as the use of metric system, a shift from absolutism to republicanism, nationalism and the belief the country belongs to the people not to one sole ruler.
hyp_text: There are many human rights and principles that are based on the concept of the metric system, one of which is the transition from absolute power in the hands of one person (absolutism) to the distribution of power among many people (republicanism), promoting the idea of helping each other for the good of the nation without prioritizing one nation over others (nationalism) and recognizing the sovereignty of each nation, where people have the right to self-determination and are not controlled by a single person.
